channel.title: welcome on Karin Cox | Pitt Neurobiology
channel.description: Recent content in welcome on Karin Cox | Pitt Neurobiology

item.title: Burst DBS in parkinsonian nonhuman primates
item.description: Can we achieve Parkinsonian symptom relief that endures long after DBS offset?

item.title: Large-scale electrophysiological recording of the subthalamic nucleus during cued reaching
item.description: How can dense sampling of STN unit spiking refine models of this region’s contributions to voluntary movement?

item.title: Detecting rhythmic spiking through the power spectra of point process model residuals
item.description: How can we isolate the oscillatory drives that contribute to a spike train?

item.title: Encoding of motor sequences in primate globus pallidus and motor cortex
item.description: How is GP and M1 activity reorganized by skilled versus unskilled movement execution?

item.title: Cerebellar- and basal ganglia-recipient thalamus activity during movement preparation and execution
item.description: In these motor thalamus subregions, how and when does single-unit spiking reflect established properties of their cerebellar and basal ganglia afferents?
